titlestmt.titleproper: Commonwealth Fund records, Elderly Program, SG 2, Series 11
A Guide to the Commonwealth Fund records, Elderly Program, SG 2, Series 11 FA1457

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-03-15 01:11:24 -0400.

did.unittitle: Commonwealth Fund records, Elderly Program, SG 2, Series 11

physdesc.extent: 27 letter-size document boxes and one half-letter document box.
27 letter-size document boxes and one half-letter document box.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Records remain in original order, as received.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The Commonwealth Fund records were donated to RAC in 1985. The initial transfer of archival records to RAC began in 1986, and tranfers continue on a regular basis. These Elderly Program filers were transferred to RAC in multiple accessions in 1998-2002.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: RAC has legal title, copyright and literary property rights to this collection in so far as it holds them.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series documents the Commonwealth Fund's activities in the area of elderly care including but not necessarily limited to medicare, medicaid, nursing home care, treatment, as well as chronic illness and end of life care. The records consist of staff program files, advisory committee meeting records, program reviews, and pertinent grants. The grant files often contain records pertaining to: budget and administration, proposals and development, articles and background information, correspondence, grant products and related program files.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.

When requesting to view audiovisual material, please refer to the Title and the AV Number (example: AV 1916). Researchers are asked to check the "Restrictions" note for each Title. If a Title does not currently have an access copy, please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.
